inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: adequate relief of global IBS symptoms and bloating

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: clinical investigations with colonoscopy within two years of recruitment

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: used antibiotic therapy or anti-inflammatory drugs within the past 7 days

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: diarrhea (bowel movements eight times in 3 hours, large volumes of greenish, liquid stool each time)

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: no history of abdominal surgery (other than cholecystectomy or appendectomy)

exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: liver function tests: alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase, alkaline phosphatase, or total bilirubin (except in isolated elevation of unconjugated bilirubin)

notes: The patient is a 60-year-old woman admitted to the stroke department with a recent history of a second course of intravenous antibiotics for aspiration pneumonia. She is febrile and complained of abdominal pain and diarrhea (bowel movements eight times in 3 hours, large volumes of greenish, liquid stool each time).
